etymologies: late 19th century: from Latin comparat- ‘paired, matched’, from the verb comparare (see compare), + -or

definitions: a device for comparing a measurable property or thing with a reference or standard.
shortDefinitions: device for comparing something measurable with reference or standard

definitions: an electronic circuit for comparing two electrical signals.
shortDefinitions: electronic circuit for comparing two electrical signals

definitions: something used as a standard for comparison

examples.text: even taking the most favorable comparator the company is about 20 percent higher

shortDefinitions: something used as standard for comparison
